content: Detroit is attempting to transform the Rust Belt into an "American Shenzhen" by combining traditional industrial resilience with modern software.
Atomic Industries is attempting to revitalize tool and die making by training AI to master the trade, aiming to bring manufacturing back to the US.
The future of American industry is believed by some founders to be in revitalized factory floors rather than clean Silicon Valley offices.
Andy Didorosi, a YouTuber and entrepreneur, purchased a 55,000-square-foot car factory for the cost of a Bay Area studio apartment, demonstrating the hustle required in Detroit.
Building hardware in 2026 involves significant challenges.
Some believe that comfort is the enemy of innovation, and Detroit, with its challenging environment, can be a cure for this.
